articles.author: Saurabh Sharma, Tariq Maqbool, Aftab Ahmed
articles.description: A fragile ceasefire was holding between India and Pakistan on Sunday, after hours of overnight fighting between the nuclear-armed neighbours, as U.S. President Donald Trump said he will work to provide a solution regarding Kashmir.
articles.title: Fragile ceasefire holds between India, Pakistan as Trump offers more help

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: With Russian forces grinding forward, Putin has offered few, if any, concessions, but has proposed talks in Istanbul that he said would be held without preconditions and aimed at a durable peace.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says he will meet Putin after Trump tells him not to await truce

articles.author: Emma Farge, John Revill
articles.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent reported "substantial progress," but offered no details of an agreement reached as two days of negotiations wrapped up in Geneva.
articles.title: US, China reach deal to cut trade deficit, US officials say, details on Monday

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Top Iranian and U.S. negotiators will resume talks on Sunday to address disputes over Tehran's nuclear programme, in a push for progress as Washington hardens its stance ahead of U.S. President Donald Trump's Middle East visit.
articles.title: Iran, US to resume nuclear talks amid clashing red lines

articles.author: Krishna N. Das, Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: How India threads the diplomatic needle - courting favour with Trump over issues like trade while asserting its own interests in the Kashmir conflict - will depend in large part on domestic politics and could determine the future prospects for conflict in Kashmir.
articles.title: India's diplomatic ambitions tested as Trump pushes for deal on Kashmir

articles.author: Alina Smutko, Herbert Villarraga
articles.description: After fending off attacks during a three-day weekend ceasefire declared by Russia, some Ukrainian soldiers fighting near the front line had advice for their president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy: don't talk to Moscow until Russian troops withdraw.
articles.title: Some Ukrainian soldiers say Russians must withdraw before any peace talks

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: The British government outlined plans on Sunday to end what it called the "failed free market experiment" in mass immigration by restricting skilled worker visas to graduate-level jobs and forcing businesses to increase training for local workers.
articles.title: UK plans to end 'failed free market experiment' in immigration

articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Philip Pullella
articles.description: Leo said the world was living through "the dramatic scenario of a Third World War being fought piecemeal," repeating a phrase coined by Pope Francis.
articles.title: Pope Leo XIV appeals for 'no more war' in first Sunday message

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Talks between Hamas and the U.S. administration regarding a ceasefire in Gaza and the entry of humanitarian aid to the besieged enclave were underway, a senior Palestinian official familiar with the discussions told Reuters on Sunday.
articles.title: Hamas in talks with US about Gaza ceasefire and aid, says senior Palestinian official

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: With Russian forces grinding forward, Vladimir Putin has offered few, if any, concessions so far. Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Kyiv was willing to talk only after Moscow agreed to a ceasefire.
articles.title: Zelenskiy cautious after Putin proposes direct peace talks with Ukraine
